Key Match Events: Wales took a 4-1 win against Finland in the play-off semi-final
David Brooks scored the first goal for Wales
Neco Williams scored a goal for Wales from a free-kick
Brennan Johnson scored a goal for Wales
Daniel James scored a goal for Wales
Teemu Pukki pulled a goal back for Finland
Post-Match Reflections: Rob Page's team set up a final date with a Poland side who ran riot in a 5-1 win against Estonia
Wales showed they can give Robert Lewandowski and Co. something to fear when they welcome them to the Cardiff City Stadium next week
Miscellaneous Highlights: The final will be played in Cardiff on March 26 and the winner will go on to join Netherlands, France and Austria in Group D
Others: Brennan Johnson and David Brooks were decisive for Wales
Daniel Hakans did not have the best of matches for the away side
